meanings.definition: To allow or permit something to escape or be released.
meanings.sent1: I will letout the air from the balloon slowly.
meanings.sent2: Please letout the dog so it can run in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The magician letout a puff of smoke from his sleeve.
meanings.sent4: The dam had to letout excess water to prevent flooding.
meanings.sent5: She letout a sigh of relief when she heard the good news.

meanings.definition: A release or escape of something, such as a sound or smell.
meanings.sent1: The letout of laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent2: There was a strange letout coming from the old house.
meanings.sent3: The letout of perfume from the bottle was overwhelming.
meanings.sent4: The letout of secrets caused quite a stir in the office.
meanings.sent5: The letout of gas from the stove made a loud hissing sound.
